If i place my window on the secondary monitor the menus in the main menu,context menus over the toolbar and other menus flickering or are not displayed correctly.  

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.drag browser window to secondary monitor
2.open the main menu in the menu bar
3.open the menus in the toolbars (tabpage overview, show more bookmarks) 
4.open a context menu in the menu bar and toolbar
Actual Results:  
menu are not displayed correctly or flickering if i move the mouse. 

Expected Results:  
the same behavior as in main monitor

comments.text:
Ditto JELangevoort's symptoms.

The two critical factors, for me, are a) hardware acceleration and b) use of the browser on the secondary (non-Windows-menu'd) monitor. It's also possible either the OS or GPU/driver needs to be in a certain range. I'm on Windows 7 with NVidia drivers v260.99 (on a GTX 460).

It's important to note: this renders the browser nearly unusable. Menus aren't navigable. You can't see what you're selecting, and can't tell where you are inside the menus. They often go completely missing.

And if I did not find this bug report, I would not have thought to turn off hardware acceleration (which is on, by default), nor shift the browser over to the primary monitor. Less technical users could be stymied.
